newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul premier calls for arrest after beating death.
newsitem.headline: Seoul premier calls for arrest after beating death.

text.p: South Korea's Prime Minister Koh Kun on Wednesday called for the speedy arrest of those responsible for the death of a man whom students have admitted they beat as a suspected police informer.
"The Prime Minister has ordered a quick arrest of those connected to the death at Hanyang University," an official at his office said.

It was not clear whether Koh's comments indicated that authorities had given a go-ahead to a police raid on the campus, where hundreds of left-wing members of the radical Hanchongryon student organisation are holed up.
Witnesses said police reinforcements were pouring in to streets around the campus, which was already ringed by helmeted riot officers.
In August last year, police staged a military-style assault on another Seoul campus to end violent protests led by the Hanchongryon.

A Hanchongryon leader admitted that a badly bruised corpse delivered to the Hanyang University teaching hospital on Wednesday was that of a man students had beaten during an interrogation in the night.
